content.question: A conducting rod with length <math alttext="l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="script">l</mi></mstyle></math> moves horizontally on a set of conducting rails through a magnetic field of magnitude <math alttext="B " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math> directed into the page, as shown. When the rod moves at a constant speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>, the <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> induced in the rod is <math alttext="epsilon" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ɛ</mi></math>. Which of the following is equal to the <math alttext="e m f " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> induced in the rod if it moves with constant speed <math alttext="2 v " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>v</mi></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
